key_points: Brian Laundrie died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head, determined by an anthropologist.
Family attorney Steve Bertolino announced the cause of death on behalf of Laundrie's parents, Chris and Roberta Laundrie.
The cause of death determination followed an inconclusive autopsy by the Sarasota County medical examiner.
Gabby Petito, Laundrie's fiance, was found dead in Wyoming, and her death was ruled a homicide by strangulation.
The case attracted national attention, highlighting both Petito's disappearance and Laundrie's subsequent disappearance.
Brian Laundrie was considered a person of interest in Gabby Petito's murder but was only charged with fraudulent use of a debit card.
Laundrie's remains were found in a Florida nature preserve close to his family's home.
The couple was documenting their cross-country road trip on social media before Petito's disappearance.
Petito and Laundrie had a documented altercation on August 12 in Utah, with police involved but no charges filed.
The Petito and Schmidt families refrain from public comments at the request of the United States Attorney's Office and the Teton County Prosecutor's Office.
